title: The inverse function theorem
text: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).
speech: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).
pacedSpeech: The inverse function theorem is that (f**(-1))'(x)=(1/f'((f**-1)(x))).

title: Finding the Inverse of f(x) at $$a=0$$.
text: To find the inverse of f(x) where $$a=2$$, then we need to first find what value of $$x$$ when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of $$2$$. In this case, it is when $$x=6$$, so we know that $$2f^{\left(-1\right)}=6$$.
speech: To find the inverse of f(x) where  a is equal to, 2 , then we need to first find what value of  x  when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of  2 . In this case, it is when  x is equal to 6 , so we know that  2, f raised to the parentheses negative 1  power is equal to 6 .

title: Finding the derivative of f(f**(-1)(x)))
text: We found that the inverse of f(x) $$=6$$ in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what f'(6) equals, which is given to us, it is $$\frac{1}{3}$$.
speech: We found that the inverse of f(x)  is equal to, 6  in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what f'(6) equals, which is given to us, it is  1 third .
pacedSpeech: We found that the inverse of f(x)   is equal to, 6
in the previous hint, therefore we need next know what f'(6) equals, which is given to us, it is   1 third

title: Applying the Inverse Function Theorem
text: Since we know that $$\operatorname{f'}\left(6f^{\left(-1\right)}\right)$$ equals $$\frac{1}{3}$$, we can can apply the inverse function theorem by doing 1/(our answer). In this case this is $$\frac{1}{\frac{1}{3}}=3$$.
